result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Dalen J Beauprey

Notice of Bail/Bond Forfeiture - DJB - Attempted - Not Known

10:04 AM Defendant Dalen J Beauprey not in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin. State asks for forfeiture of any bond posted, bench warrant body or $500.00. Court so orders.

10:10 AM Defendant Dalen J Beauprey appeared by video with leave of the Court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Charles James Simono in court for State of Wisconsin. Court reviews file, no SPD appointment yet, continues bond, stay in constant contact with SPD, sets for AIA on 8/31/22 at 10:00 AM.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:59 AM Prosecuting attorney Charles James Simono in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Dalen J Beauprey in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court. Court reviews file, asks about attorney status. Beauprey states that he has been in contact with SPD, is eligible, they have not appointed him one. Court reminds him of his right to hire his own counsel. Defendant states he cannot afford his own. Court continues bond, have SPD sent a letter to the Court informing the Court that he is indeed eligible for SPD, will allow the defendant to appear via Zoom if he is SPD eligible and they do not have anyone appointed to his case, if he has an attorney - must appear in person. Court continues bond, sets for AIA on 7/13/22 at 10:15 AM.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 13, 2022 at 10:15 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Dalen J Beauprey
Current: 226 South Lincoln Road, Escanaba, MI 49829 United States  (Effective: 04-04-2022)
Prior: 5626 We J Mogek Ct, Crandon, WI 54520

9:42 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Dalen J Beauprey appeared by video.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court. Court makes reference to he thought the defendant was supposed to be appearing from a treatment facility, does not appear he is in a treatment facility today. Defendant responds, was supposed to be in there as of 5/16/22 but they called and changed the date to 5/23/22, defendant states he has not contacted SPD lately. Court warns him of not contacting them and following the rules of the Court by not contacting them. Defendant understands. Court will set for another AIA, can only appear by Zoom if he has contacted SPD as instructed to, even if in treatment. Court continues bond, sets for AIA on 6/29/22 at 10:00 AM.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Cash bond re-instated. Returned from FOSO
Adjourned initial appearance on May 18, 2022 at 09:45 am.

10:03 AM Defendant Dalen J Beauprey in court, in custody.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Beauprey appears telephonically with leave of the Court from a corrections center in Jackson, MI. Court - her today for a BBR as the poster is asking for the bond money back. Also appearing is Patricia Beauprey. Beauprey states it was actually the defendant's money and explains the situation (loaned money to defendant's mother to get her car out of impound for something that the defendant did). Beauprey makes statement, only being held on the warrant from Forest County of $500.00, asks Court to reinstate the original $300.00 cash that was ordered forfeited or asks that Patricia can pay an additional $200.00 and use that money with the original $300.00 to poay the warrant in the amount of $500.00. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Beauprey understands charges and penalties, wants an attorney. Court directs defendant to contat SPD and also explains court appointed as well. Beauprey states he has the number for SPD. Court will set aside the forfeiture, reinstates the $300.00 cash bond, quashes the warrant, sets for AIA on 5/18/22 at 9:45 AM, not returning the bond to Patricia Beauprey for stated reasons, verifies address and phone number.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 09:45 am.

from poster to have her money returned to her. Sent to JA for scheduling.

09:40 AM Defendant Dalen J Beauprey not in court.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State had gotten word that Beauprey was picked up from FC jail after posting bond and transported to Michigan and based on failure to appear, asks for forfeiture of money posted and asks for nationwide warrant of body or $500. Court so orders.
